text:
11 Things to Do in Yangon | Top Attractions
Myanmar

This is Christine Kaaloa of GRRRLTRAVELER
and we're in Myanmar Burma.
Rise and shine.
Wanna get a jump on your first day in Yangon?
[#1 Monks Taking Alms]

Watching baby monks pour through the neighborhoods
collecting alms.
[#2 Pe Byeok]
Pe byeok is a traditional Burmese breakfast.

It's seasoned lentil beans taken with a slice
of naan bread.

[ #3 Taking the local bus]
Today I'm going to the Shwe Dagon Pagoda but

instead of taking a taxi there, i'm taking
the local bus.

[#4 Explore the Streets]
The beauty of finding your way around vs.

taking a taxi is that you come across little
neighborhoods.
You discover these wonderful places.

You can find some of these places with a taxi
or see some of it on the way.
But when you're on the streets...
it's a completely different feeling.

You get more time to take it in and really
observe things.
Hey!
[#5 Make Friends]
[Burmese chatter]

[#6 Ask Questions]
What is that?
Ooh, ooh, ooh?
They're eggs.
Birds?
My drug dealer is actually an egg dealer.

[#7 Seamstress Alley]
Near the Shwe Dagon Pagoda are many hidden

shops and a variety of marketplace vendors
and traditional Burmese craft shops.

I found this seamstress alley catering to
traditional Burmese clothing.

If my American size can't fit what's in the
stores, I'm sure I can get them here.

[#8 Betel nut]
This is a highly addictive chewing tobacco
called Betel Nut.

And you'll find many street vendors serving
up their own concoction.

Finally here we are a the home stretch [Shwe
dagon pagoda].
But there's still so many distractions...

[#9 Sculptor Shops]
I stop by to watch the sculptors at work chiseling
religious statues.

[#10 Monk Boutique shops]
And then I stop by some monk boutique shops
where the monks go for the latest fashion.

[#11 Shwe Dagon Pagoda]
Shwe Dagon Pagoda.. it's a huge complex of
temples everywhere.

All around the pagoda there are temples ... it's
so bright I have to squint.
It's so beautiful to look at.
